inputs.description: An existing file name. Structural *intensity* image, typically t1. if more than one anatomical image is specified, subsequently specified images are used during the segmentation process. however, only the first image is used in the registration of priors. our suggestion would be to specify the t1 as the first image.
inputs.name: Anatomical image

inputs.description: A boolean. Use b-spline syn for registrations and b-spline exponential mapping in direct.
inputs.name: B spline smoothing

inputs.description: An existing file name. Brain probability mask in template space.
inputs.name: Brain probability mask

inputs.description: An existing file name. Anatomical *intensity* template (possibly created using a population data set with buildtemplateparallel.sh in ants). this template is  *not* skull-stripped.
inputs.name: Brain template

inputs.description: An existing file name. Cortical roi labels to use as a prior for atith.
inputs.name: Cortical label image

inputs.description: A boolean. If > 0, runs a faster version of the script. only for testing. implies -u 0. requires single thread computation for complete reproducibility.
inputs.name: Debug

inputs.description: 3 or 2. Image dimension (2 or 3).
inputs.name: Dimension

inputs.description: An existing file name. Mask (defined in the template space) used during registration for brain extraction.
inputs.name: Extraction registration mask

inputs.description: A unicode string. Any of standard itk formats, nii.gz is default.
inputs.name: Image suffix
Keep temporary files
inputs.description: An integer (int or long). Keep brain extraction/segmentation warps, etc (default = 0).

A unicode string. Incorporate a distance prior one the posterior formulation.  should be of the form 'label[lambda,boundaryprobability]' where label is a value of 1,2,3,... denoting label id.  the label probability for anything outside the current label = boundaryprobability * exp( -lambda * distancefromboundary ) intuitively, smaller lambda values will increase the spatial capture range of the distance prior.  to apply to all label values, simply omit specifying the label, i.e. -l [lambda,boundaryprobability].
inputs.name: Label propagation
Max iterations
inputs.description: An integer (int or long). Ants registration max iterations (default = 100x100x70x20).
An integer (int or long). Number of itk threads to use.
inputs.name: Num threads

inputs.description: A unicode string. Prefix that is prepended to all output files (default = antsct_).
inputs.name: Out prefix

inputs.description: A unicode string. Atropos posterior formulation and whether or not to use mixture model proportions. e.g 'socrates[1]' (default) or 'aristotle[1]'. choose the latter if you want use the distance priors (see also the -l option for label propagation control).
inputs.name: Posterior formulation

inputs.description: A float. Atropos spatial prior *probability* weight for the segmentation.
inputs.name: Prior segmentation weight

inputs.description: A boolean. If = 1, use antsregistrationsynquick.sh as the basis for registration during brain extraction, brain segmentation, and (optional) normalization to a template. otherwise use antsregistrationsyn.sh (default = 0).
inputs.name: Quick registration
Segmentation iterations
inputs.description: An integer (int or long). N4 -> atropos -> n4 iterations during segmentation (default = 3).

inputs.name: Segmentation priors
inputs.description: A list of items which are an existing file name. No description provided.

An existing file name. Anatomical *intensity* template (assumed to be skull-stripped). a common case would be where this would be the same template as specified in the -e option which is not skull stripped.
inputs.name: T1 registration template

inputs.description: 0 or 1. Use floating point precision in registrations (default = 0).
inputs.name: Use floatingpoint precision

inputs.description: 0 or 1. Use random number generated from system clock in atropos (default = 1).
inputs.name: Use random seeding

description: CorticalThickness, as implemented in Nipype (module: nipype.interfaces.ants, interface: CorticalThickness).
author: Nipype (interface), Brian B. Avants et al. (tool)
